description: Construction of part single and part two-storey sports pavilion with roof terrace; layout of grassed sports pitches and provision of synthetic sports pitch with floodlights; and associated vehicle parking and landscaping (following demolition of single storey sports pavilion) (Regulation 3 - Council's Own Application)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing titles: Plans: 112.17-HBA-DR-A-0002, 112.17-HBA-DR-A-0003 Rev C, 112.17-HBA-DR-A-0004 Rev A, 112.17-HBA-DR-A-0005, 112.17-HBA-DR-A-0010 Rev A, 112.17-HBA-DR-A-0006 and the Preliminary Ecology Appraisal by David Archer Associates dated November 2017.
Reason: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning

| Details of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces (including hardstanding and boundary treatments) of the development hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any part of the development is commenced and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| A. No demolition or development shall take place until a stage 1 written archaeological scheme of investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, and the programme and methodology of site evaluation and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works.

B. Where archaeological remains of high significance are identified by stage 1 then development details which set out the method for preservation in situ of these remains should be submitted to an approved by the local planning authority in writing. Typically this would involve a design and methods statement for groundworks.

C. If archaeological remains of medium or low significance are identified by stage 1 then for those parts of the site which have such archaeological interest a stage 2 WSI shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the stage 2 WSI, no demolition/development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed stage 2 WSI which shall include:

i.	The statement of significance and research objectives, the programme and methodology of site investigation and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works;

ii.	The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication & dissemination and deposition of resulting material. This part of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the stage 2 WSI.

Reason: To safeguard the archaeological interest of the site in accordance with policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2016), and policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD. | Ten cycle storage spaces shall be provided as shown on drawing 112.17-HBA-DR-A-0003 Rev C in accordance with adopted standards prior to first use of the replacement sports pavilion hereby approved and shall be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| Details of hard/soft landscape works including a Landscape Management Plan, site furniture and boundary treatments shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and residential amenity of prospective occupiers, and in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4, and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(b) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework.

| Prior to commencement of the development (including ground works) detailed drainage designs to demonstrate that SUDS features (if possible linked to native planting works and surface attenuation swales) will be constructed to accommodate volume run-off in accordance with the Drainage Strategy report (October 2017) and drainage assessment form shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved SUDS features shall be maintained and permanently be retained thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure that sufficient capacity is made available to cope with additional demand in the interest of environmental conditions in the locality, in accordance with policy 1.1 (e), 1.2 (m) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 5.14 and 5.16 of The London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to first use of the pavilion hereby approved the car parking spaces shown on the approved plan 112.17-HBA-DR-A-0003 Rev C shall be marked out on the site and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.
Reason: to ensure there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to first use of the pavilion the parking bay designated for disabled drivers and the parking bays to provide electric vehicle charging points as shown on drawing number 112.17-HBA-DR-A-0003 Rev C shall be marked out for disabled driver use and retained thereafter for that use.
Reason: to ensure there is adequate provision for disabled car parking and vehicle charging facilities within the site in accordance with policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| The floodlights hereby approved shall only be used between 0830 and 2200 hours Monday to Friday and 0830 to 2030 hours on Saturday Sunday and Bank Holidays. Such floodlights are to be switched off immediately thereafter.

Reason: To protect the amenity and living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 7.15 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012), Policy 7A of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained within the Council's interim guidance 'Noise and Vibration' (formerly SPG 10 detailing noise criteria).
| The floodlights hereby approved shall be provided in accordance with the luminance and other specifications set out in the submitted floodlights specification document dated 22 December 2017.

Reason: To protect the amenity and living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 7.15 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012), Policy 7A of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained within the Council's interim guidance 'Noise and Vibration' (formerly SPG 10 detailing noise criteria).

| A Nature Conservation Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development (including site clearance and demolition). This shall provide full details of biodiversity enhancements and measures to ensure minimum ecological impacts during construction, including surveys of bats, reptiles and breeding birds, as outlined in the Preliminary Ecology Appraisal (prepared by David Archer Associates, dated November 2017). The approved details shall be implemented onsite prior to the first occupation of the development and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To mitigate the potential harm to ecology within the green open space in accordance with policy 11 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policy 7.19 of the London Plan (2015) and policy 5.4 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| Any machinery audible outside the pavilion hereby approved must be designed to be an acoustic standard not exceeding Noise Rating NR35 measured or calculated at the nearest horizontal or vertical boundary of the nearest affected dwelling, whichever is the closer.

Reason: To protect the amenity and living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 7.15 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2016), Policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012), Policy 7A of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained within the Council's interim guidance 'Noise and Vibration' (formerly SPG 10 detailing noise criteria).
| The proposed sports pitches, cricket field and cricket nets shall not be used outside the hours of 0830 and 2200 hours Monday to Friday and 0830 to 2030 hours on Saturday Sunday and Bank Holidays.

Reason: To protect the amenity and living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 7.15 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2016), Policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012), Policy 7A of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained within the Council's interim guidance 'Noise and Vibration' (formerly SPG 10 detailing noise criteria).

| Tree planting shall be carried out as specified on Landscape Master Plan 112.17-HBA-DR-A-0010 Rev A and the submitted Masterplan Planting Schedule.  All tree-planting shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved scheme in the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) to the completion of the approved development. The quality of all approved landscape works shall be in accordance with British Standard 4428:1989 'Code Of Practice For General Landscape Operations' or any subsequent revision. All trees included within the approved scheme shall be healthy, well-formed specimens with single leading shoots and shall be of a minimum quality compatible with British Standard 3936:1992 (Part 1) 'Specifications For Trees & Shrubs' and British Standard 4043 (where applicable) or any subsequent revisions. Any trees which within a period of 5 years from the completion of all tree planting die, are removed, uprooted are significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed shall be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with others of the same size, species and quality as approved.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (i) and 1.2 (d) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan and policy 5.10 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development shall be used as a sports facility for outdoor sporting activity and ancillary activities and for no other purpose including any other uses falling within Class D2 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) (Amendment) Order 2015.

Reason: In the interests of maintaining an appropriate use within Metropolitan Open Land, in accordance with policies 3.19 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 5.2 and 5.6 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012).
| No sound amplification devices shall be utilised within the open areas of the site.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of adjacent occupiers, in accordance with policies 7.15 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2016), Policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012), Policy 7A of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained within the Council's interim guidance 'Noise and Vibration' (formerly SPG 10 detailing noise criteria).
| The sports pavilion shall not be used outside the hours of 0830 to 2200 hours Monday to Friday and 0830 to 2030 hours on weekends and at no time on Bank Holidays.
Reason: To protect the amenity and living conditions of neighbouring occupiers

in accordance with policies 7.15 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2016), Policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012), Policy 7A of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained within the Council's interim guidance 'Noise and Vibration' (formerly SPG 10 detailing noise criteria).
